result.title: Solutions for end-to-end security and privacy for distributed CPS v2
result.description: Report on developed solutions to preserve end-to-end security and privacy in edge/cloud computing when deploying running distributed applications for safety-critical applications, consistent with the TRANSACT reference architecture and based on the concepts defined in D3.2. Analysis of the interactions with the solutions for end-to-end safety and performance defined in D3.3. The report due on M33 is a refinement/extension of the report of M18. The deliverable further includes a contribution to the PolarSys open ecosystem, specifically extensions security assurance and (re)qualification. This report will indicate which elements are open-sourced and will feed into D6.5.

result.title: Solutions for end-to-end safety and performance for distributed CPS v2
result.description: Report on developed solutions to monitor, predict and manage end-to-end safety and performance in distributed CPS, including safeguards and graceful degradation techniques and re-qualification techniques, consistent with the TRANSACT reference architecture and based on the concept defined in D3.1. Analysis of the interactions with the solutions for end-to-end security and privacy defined in D3.3. The report due on M33 is a refinement/extension of the report of M18. The deliverable further includes a contribution to the PolarSys open ecosystem, specifically extensions for safety assurance and (re)qualification. This report will indicate which elements are open-sourced and will feed into D6.5.

result.title: New business models enabled by local and cloud services
result.description: Compared to monolithic applications, distributed solutions demand new approaches to monetize the resulting products. This deliverable describes possible implementations of new business models with special focus on the role and provisioning aspects of the cloud service to support this approach, the role of 3rd party services and open source software building blocks.
